image.altText: A man crying while his family stands next to him

props.synopsis: After his mother put in her two weeks notice on New Year's Eve, the newly minted King Frederik X has been proclaimed monarch of Denmark. Here's everything that happened while you were asleep.

title.children: Denmark's King Frederik wanted a low-key ascension. But one thing he saw brought him to tears

image.altText: Two young kids and an elderly woman wave miniature Danish flags.

props.synopsis: From picnics at the beach near where Mary grew up, to friends of her late mother getting together to mark the milestone, here's how Australians celebrated a rise of one of their own.

title.children: Australians celebrate as local girl Mary rises to Danish queen

image.altText: Frederik and Mary wave happily from a balcony.

props.synopsis: Denmark's longest reigning monarch, Queen Margrethe II, signs the declaration of her abdication, triggering the ascension of her son Prince Frederik and Australian-born Princess Mary.

title.children: Australia's Princess Mary becomes Queen of Denmark with royal proclamation of King Frederik X

image.altText: A man in an orange shirt, facing away, sits in a car with the doors open.

props.synopsis: Around 70,000 people live in Australia unlawfully. To avoid getting caught, Shan had to go underground — a path he warns no-one should walk.

title.children: When police pulled Shan over, he knew his secret life had just come undone

image.altText: a woman standing smiling, with palms behind her

props.synopsis: Auslan interpreters were missing when it was declared ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper had strengthened to a category four system, and when Gold Coast residents were urged to stay home during severe storms.

title.children: Auslan interpreters missing from major updates as cyclone, tornado and storms hit Queensland

image.altText: Young unidentified female student with textbooks.

props.synopsis: University offers for domestic students are based on an Australian Tertiary Admissions Rank (ATAR), but there are different criteria for students from overseas.

title.children: Why are tertiary entry requirements different for international and domestic students?

image.altText: A large gold symbol featuring two patterned circles next to International Court of Justice written in capital letters

props.synopsis: A compelling legal and public relations battle is underway at the International Court of Justice as two nations battle for reputation and the history books, writes John Lyons.

title.children: The question of genocide in Gaza is a battle for reputation and history

image.altText: Christopher O'Connell holds out his hands

props.synopsis: A shockingly bad umpires call, the early tournament start can't stop another late start to a match, but its quick finish leaves a qualifier playing through the tears. Here are five quick hits from day one at Melbourne Park.

title.children: Five quick hits — Sabalenka reduces her teenage opponent to tears after Djokovic dragged to late finish by his

image.altText: Alex de Minaur points up to the sky

props.synopsis: Is it easier to win your home grand slam than any other major? Some stats suggest that top players are more likely to win at home, but it's not as simple as that, Simon Smale writes.

title.children: It's been 48 years since an Australian man won the Australian Open — can de Minaur break that drought?

image.altText: A rock formation overlooking a body of water.

props.synopsis: NSW Police say a search for the boy began after he was reported missing on Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Teenage boy dies after reportedly jumping from rock ledge at NSW waterhole

image.altText: Brisbane inner city suburbs rooftops solar panels

props.synopsis: St Vincent de Paul calls for an urgent shake-up of power bills, warning the cost of Australia's clean energy transition is disproportionately falling on poorer customers.

title.children: Charity warns vulnerable households bearing brunt of green energy schemes

image.altText: A photo taken from above of four people doing a jigsaw puzzle together on a black table

props.synopsis: We take a look at some of the latest research on keeping your brain healthy and reducing the risk of dementia.

title.children: Ways to reduce the risk of dementia and improve brain health that may surprise you

image.altText: A smiling young woman with short, dark hair pulls a beer at a pub.

props.synopsis: In rural and regional Australia, backpackers provide a seasonal workforce that keeps towns running in busy months, but impending changes to the visa scheme have some operators worried.

title.children: Fears visa change for British backpackers spells trouble for outback businesses

image.altText: A woman smiles in a large shed in front of a basket of tomatoes.

props.synopsis: With allegations of price gouging levelled at the major supermarkets and an inquiry ongoing, more Australians are seeking other ways to get their groceries.

title.children: Meet the Australians cutting out the supermarket middle-man

image.altText: A yellow road closed sign stands on the roadway in front of a police car that is blocking the highway.

props.synopsis: An 11-year-old boy and 26-year-old woman are dead after a car hit a tree and burst into flames near Echuca.

title.children: Child and woman die in road crash in Victoria's north

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged woman leans on a bar beneath a sign that says "Opal Bar".

props.synopsis: During a deadly bushfire crisis last year, the Glengarry Hilton at Grawin Opal Fields threw its doors open to everyone who needed shelter, including the men and women battling the blaze.

title.children: When disaster struck, this pub became much more than a place to have a beer

image.altText: a composite image of two men and two women

props.synopsis: Don't attempt to adjust your TV set. The 2023 Emmys really are time travelling forward to 2024 thanks to last year's writers' strikes.

title.children: It's almost time for the 75th Emmy Awards. Here's how to watch and why 2023 ceremony is happening in 2024

image.altText: A woman stands next to a vehicle holding an electric cable.

props.synopsis: The government of South-East Asia's largest auto market is determined to increase domestic EV use and at the same time become a leading zero-emissions vehicle maker.

title.children: Tax cuts and electricity discounts among incentives Indonesia hopes will boost EV use

image.altText: Orange smoke billows from boiling hot lava seen from above, lighting up the dark surroundings.

props.synopsis: A volcano erupted in southwest Iceland, posing an immediate threat to a nearby fishing town that had been evacuated over fears of an outbreak, authorities say.

title.children: Volcanic eruption sees Iceland fishing town evacuated for second time in a month

image.altText: A man looks off camera with a considered expression

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has made progress ticking off hundreds of commitments made to taxpayers before the March 2022 election. But it still has a long way to go on key areas like health, integrity and cost-of-living, writes Stephanie Richards and Rory McClaren.

title.children: The biggest political hurdles the SA government will face in 2024

image.altText: Donald Trump waves as he stands behind a barricade separating him and his detail from a large crowd.

props.synopsis: This week's Iowa caucuses signal the start of the primary race for the 2024 US election. Donald Trump's the strongest polling Republican, but many caucus-goers say there are better options.

title.children: 'So many Trump haters': As a small state holds first big US vote, some Republicans are turning

image.altText: aerial view of a crashed yellow plane

props.synopsis: It is believed the pilot was attempting to land at Boonah Airfield when the plane crashed.

title.children: Police confirm two dead in light plane crash at Boonah, south of Brisbane

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: mass rescue at sydney's maroubra beach after a group of swimmers got caught in a rip on sunday january 14 2024

props.synopsis: On Sunday afternoon, races in the Ironmen and Ironwomen series were drawing to a close at Maroubra Beach when competitors spotted the group struggling in the water.

title.children: Mass rescue at Sydney's Maroubra Beach after '20 to 30' swimmers caught in flash rip

image.altText: a young african man sitting behind weights at a gym

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old man is being extradited from Victoria to Alice Springs where he is expected to be charged with murder. Two other people are expected to be charged as accessory after the fact, following the discovery of Mr Gatluak's body on January 1.

title.children: Man to be extradited, charged with murder over death of Yiel Gatluak

image.altText: An army helicopter sits on the tarmac as the setting sun casts golden light across it from the left.

props.synopsis: Protesters from the Ukrainian community are stepping up pressure on the Albanese government over its decision to dismantle and bury Australia's retired fleet of Taipan helicopters instead of sending them to the war-torn nation.

title.children: Ukraine wants Australia's decommissioned Taipan fleet, but helicopters appear destined for scrap yard

image.altText: Emergency crews at a Coober Pedy mine site.

props.synopsis: A man trapped down a mine shaft outside Coober Pedy in SA's far north has been taken to hospital with injuries including a fractured leg, after a three-hour rescue operation involving multiple emergency services, authorities say.

title.children: Man rescued from Coober Pedy opal mine after becoming trapped in shaft

image.altText: An aerial of a house with smoke billowing from a nearby bushfire.

props.synopsis: One of two emergency bushfires burning north of Perth is downgraded, as firefighters battle several out-of-control blazes north of Perth.

title.children: Hundreds of firefighters battle out-of-control blazes north of Perth as temperatures soar

image.altText: A close-up of a dark-coloured worm in a bucket.

props.synopsis: Robert Norris and his 17-year-old daughter were looking for mud crabs in a Queensland creek when they found themselves witnessing something they did not expect.

title.children: Swarm of mysterious worms filled with 'green goo' baffles fisho dad and daughter

image.altText: eighty-year-old william newbold who has been charged with alleged sexual assault of woman 87 at Sydney aged care

props.synopsis: William Newbold, 80, was visiting another resident at the facility in the city's north-west when he allegedly entered the woman's room and had non-consensual sexual contact with her on two occasions.

title.children: Elderly man charged with sexual assault of woman, 87, at Sydney aged care released from custody

image.altText: Steve Smith smiles while holding his cricket bat in front of a leafy backdrop

props.synopsis: A reinvigorated Steve Smith has not considered what it would mean for his future if the move to Test opener does not pay off for Australia.

title.children: Smith not facing fear of failure as he prepares for move to top of Australian order

image.altText: Emergency workers at a house damaged by a van.

props.synopsis: Two people and a pet dog are lucky to have avoided serious injury, police said, after a van that left the road and "became airborne" smashed through the front window of a house at Nairne in the Adelaide Hills on Saturday night.

title.children: Van that 'became airborne' narrowly misses two people in lounge

image.altText: A woman with dyed red hair and glasses in a tie and suit vest and a woman with blonde hair and a green sweater

props.synopsis: The Pope's recent pronouncement against surrogacy has sparked heated global debate about the controversial issue. In Australia, surrogacy is complex: deplored by some but embraced by others whose lives have been transformed by remarkable acts of generosity and love.

title.children: Alice and Olivia were both conceived via surrogacy. Today, they have contrasting views on the controversial practice
